none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on October 01, 2019 Description from Terminal Escape:
The brooding and foreboding introduction of "Nostalgia" sets the scene, pulling down the shades and blocking escape routes to give the rest of Phone Sex an unhindered platform and/or playground. Primitive dance floor fetish slammers in the vein of CHRIS & COSEY or Voice Of America-era CABARET VOLTAIRE, PSYCHIC HOTLINE add an air of innocence while keeping shit decidedly weird and disorienting ("Intimacy" is the perfect example of this sonic conflict). It's a sonic existence rooted in the past future, and the result feels wholly present.  PHONE SEX
https://psychich0tline.bandcamp.com/merch https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=youtu.be&v=ffbJPEJcCRM&app=desktop
